artist: Artist: Ryūryūkyo Shinsai; Publisher: Maruya Bun'emon; Inscriber: Dondontei Wataru
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Shirataki Saijirō was 14 when this portrait was created, and he was already five-feet-nine and 190 pounds. His career as a sumo wrestler in Edo was very brief—he only appeared in one tournament, in1813, where he lost all bouts. This near-pristine print must have been produced shortly thereafter.
title: The Sumo Wrestler Shirataki Saijirō
